creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
medium: Six-panel folding screen, one of a pair, ink and color on silver leafed paper
object_name: folding screen, six-panel, one of a pair
text: The Gods of Wind and Thunder stem from Hindu deities that were assimilated into the Buddhist pantheon and later merged with indigenous Shintō personifications of natural elements. Here, the Thunder God is identified by his red skin and drums, which he beats to create thunderclaps.
title: God of Thunder [right of the pair Gods of Thunder, Wind, and Rain]
